instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 only start in smc bypass
threads.message: so customer brought in this macbook, doesnt start with normal power button, but can turn on, in smc bypass, took out the logicboard, found that the trace cr5479 and r5479 is gone, so i jumper it, because there are corrosion near smc, I has tried reballing smc, but still only start at smc bypass..

threads.title: 820-4924 only start in smc bypass
threads.message:
What is the voltage at C5479?
Check traces continuity for R5477-79.
Also check AVREF_SMC voltage.

Don't forget to check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7100.

threads.title: 820-4924 only start in smc bypass
threads.message:
c5479 0v
pp3v3_s5_Avref_smc = 0v
measured it while charging, but I don't turn it on with smc bypass
continuity all good.., is the traces at pin 1of C5749 which was gone the problem?

threads.title: 820-4924 only start in smc bypass
threads.message:
Check for short at AVREF_SMC.
If yes, C5125 and C5021 are the first suspects.
If no short, change U5110.

threads.title: 820-4924 only start in smc bypass
threads.message:
damn, sorry my brain isn't engaged, how could i forget to check short on 0v line,,
one of the caps is blown, replaced, and it boots normally now, thankss a lott!!
